title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 202.4 - Nominations for committee membership
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 202.4 - Nominations for committee membership

State Regulations

Agriculture and Markets Law, ยง 294(2)
(a) (1)

The
commissioner shall cause to be held a meeting of New York State cherry growers, at which time the growers in attendance will nominate 16 growers to be eligible
for appointment as members of the sour cherry advisory committee. Eight of said
nominees shall be growers whose farms are located east of Rochester, and eight
shall be growers whose farms are located west of Rochester. (2)

The next such grower meeting shall be
called by the commissioner between January 1, 1974 and June 1, 1974 and, beginning in 1976, biennial meetings shall be held between January first and

June first, for as long as this marketing order is in effect. In the event that
additional nominations are needed, the commissioner may call a special grower
meeting for that purpose. (b) The Associated New York State Food

Processors, Inc., or successor organization by whatever name known, shall
nominate six members to be eligible for appointment as processor members of the
committee. (c) Not more than one
member shall be appointed from any single grower or processor
operation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
202.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
